Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Linux -- No ndk support for LLVM, BundleAssembles, or AotAssemblies" (#2137) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi all,

Having issues with NDK features on Linux.  They don't work at all.  Have to disable to build.  I am also worried about continued support.

### Version Information

I am referring to build 993 of https://jenkins.mono-project.com/view/Xamarin.Android/job/xamarin-android-linux/

This is v17 of the android-ndk as well

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Using Makefile Project (Android) doesn't copy the libs to the main project" (#2136) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use standard hello world sample Xamarin Android project
2. Use standard Hello Jni from Android samples
3. Create new Makefile Project (Android)
4. Copy hello-jnc.c and Makefiles to project
5. Add NDK Project Path to nmake call (This should be default by the way!)

I prepared a demo here:
[bugReport.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2346521/bugReport.zip)


### Expected Behavior
1. Build should also build the MakeFile Project
2. The libs should be added to the ouput directory of the Main project

### Actual Behavior
1. Needs to be triggered manually
2. The libs are in a subfolder which is cool but there is no automated way to tell VS that these libs belong to my build. Even copying them manually does not work, they are NOT included in the APK

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] _CopyIntermediateAssemblies uses CopyIfChanged" (#2128) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/2088

970da9ef was a good step towards "correctness" in building
incrementally in the following scenario:
- File | New Xamarin.Forms project | NetStandard library
- Build
- Change XAML
- Build

In this scenario, there is now a new target rising to the surface we
can improve:

    276 ms  _CopyIntermediateAssemblies                1 calls

Looking at the target, it seems we could use the `CopyIfChanged` task
here more effectively. This task will automaticaly set the timestamps
of files that have been copied, and so we don't need any subsequent
`<ItemGroup />` or `<Touch />` elements. It was also touching *all*
files instead of just the ones that were changed.

After this change:

    33 ms  _CopyIntermediateAssemblies                1 calls

The overall build went from 7.058s to 6.652s, so there must be some
other targets that benefit from the timestamps not changing on *all*
of these files.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] simplify inputs to _CompileToDalvik" (#2131) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Recently I've been discovering more and more places where usage of
`**\*.*` can hurt the performance of our build.

In this case, the `_FindCompiledJavaFiles` target:

    <Target Name="_FindCompiledJavaFiles" DependsOnTargets="_CompileJava">
        <CreateItem Include="$(IntermediateOutputPath)android\bin\classes\\**\*.class">
            <Output TaskParameter="Include" ItemName="_CompiledJavaFiles" />
        </CreateItem>
    </Target>

This target is running even in builds with no changes, so we are
*always* recursing directories and finding `*.class` files.

But since we are using a `classes.zip` file now, we don't need to
recurse and find the `*.class` files at all anymore!

I was able to remove this target completely, and change
`$(_CompileToDalvikInputs)` to use
`$(IntermediateOutputPath)android\bin\classes.zip`. Less inputs also
help build times, because MSBuild won't have to evaluate timestamps on
all the `*.class` files. It can just look at the single `classes.zip`
file.

To see the difference, a build with no changes was taking:

    46 ms  _FindCompiledJavaFiles                     1 calls
    15 ms  _CompileToDalvikWithDx                     1 calls

After these changes:

    4 ms  _CompileToDalvikWithDx                     1 calls

`_FindCompiledJavaFiles` is gone completely.

I also made sure to include `_CompileJava` in
`$(_CompileToDalvikDependsOnTargets)` in place of
`_FindCompiledJavaFiles`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Tools.BootstrapTasks] Make output of UnzipDirectoryChildren less messy" (#2134) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The lines are all messed up because the underlying unzip command uses 2 steps to print a line: first the line content, then the '\n'. This can race across processes and makes the output quite hard to read.

This fixes that by making sure we print the whole "line+'\n'" at the same time. This doesn't completely reduce the chance of broken line, but it greatly reduces it anyway.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Reference self-developed .NET library to Xamarin.Android got archiving issue" (#2135) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
This is Allen from APGC Xamarin support team. I got one customer built one .NET library by themselves, previously they are always directly referencing the project as the DLL to Xamarin.Android project. It works previously about half month ago when archiving the project to APK file, but it suddenly does not work and shows the below error message once customer clicked into the Archive for Publish:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36911474/44973443-2e7e1880-af8f-11e8-887f-09df0f7a7254.png)

If we double clicked on this error, it will get into below configuration part:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36911474/44973471-4190e880-af8f-11e8-9fcc-58c11738d750.png)

Currently I found one workaround is that we unload the .NET library project and reference the dll file from the bin\release folder directly.

But customer still wants to know why this is happening and what's the difference between these 2 approaches.

Please let me know if there is anything that we can check or logs to capture that can help to analyze the issue.

Thanks,

Allen Liu

Events.RelatedBody:
The lines are all messed up because the underlying unzip command uses 2 steps to print a line: first the line content, then the '\n'. This can race across processes and makes the output quite hard to read.

This fixes that by making sure we print the whole "line+'\n'" at the same time. This doesn't completely reduce the chance of broken line, but it greatly reduces it anyway.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[WIP] [Mono.Android] make Stream seekable." (#2133) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
There are some Android API that returns java.io.InputStream, which we
convert to System.IO.Stream and support `skip()` method, which works
like `Seek()` in .NET land.
Our Stream implementation is sadly less functional and `Seek()` throws
NotSupportedException. It is particularly problematic when we try to
open and seek Android assets via `AssetManager.Open()`.

Here is an "aggressive" implementation that supports those operations
(Java API for seek operation is fugly and cannot be simply implemented).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Android popup menu moving top-left" (#3697) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
If I use a Secondary Toolbar-Item to push a new page through a ViewModel on to the Navigation stack, the popup menu item is moving to the top-left corner before disappearing. This only happens when a page is pushed, not when the page stays the same.

### Steps to Reproduce
I think it happens mostly with older projects.
1. Create a secondary toolbar item
2. Create a ViewModel with a command pushing a new Page onto the navigation stack
3. Bind the command to the toolbar item

### Expected Behavior
Popup menu item disappering and new page opening

### Actual Behavior
Popup menu item moving to the top-left corner before disappearing and opening new page

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version: don't know
- IDE: MS Visual Studio 15.7.4
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: 8.0
- Android Support Library Version: 27.0.2.1
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:

### Screenshots

![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4274219/44986661-d3472880-af84-11e8-9f44-0f140893782b.gif)


### Reproduction Link
I used the MasterDetail Example to reproduce as it was the "cleanest" project I had around with this issue. I could not reproduce it with every project.
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kROvYO5C-tdNZKhaATnqaTbsMBqcBRs4/view?usp=sharing

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Labels not always rendering in a StackLayout on UWP." (#3398) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

`Label`s not always rendering in a `StackLayout` on UWP.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run attached sample. Browse to the "Swipe Page (XAML)", or the "Swipe Page (C#)"
2. Observe the page layout.

### Expected Behavior

There should be a `Label`, followed by a `BoxView`, followed by a `Label`.

### Actual Behavior

Swipe Page (XAML)

A `Label` and a `BoxView`, but no second `Label`:

![01uwp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8092460/43200065-07bcc270-900c-11e8-89a3-f21759dd962c.PNG)

Swipe Page (C#)

A `BoxView` but no `Label`s:

![02uwp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8092460/43200073-0bc252ea-900c-11e8-841b-3f4baed9f3a8.PNG)

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.2.0.637442-pre1
- IDE: VSMac 
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - UWP:  10.0.17134.0 

### Reproduction Link

[SwipeGesture.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2227820/SwipeGesture.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SearchBar not visible in iOS 10 when using CenterAndExpand" (#2139) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
The Xamarin Forms SearchBar does not appear when using iOS 10. It appears to be fine on iOS 11. Adding HeightRequest does not seem to work
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add a SearchBar to a Xamarin Forms Content Page
2. Run an iOS simulator or device in iOS 10.3
3. SearchBar is not visible

### Expected Behavior
SearchBar should appear
### Actual Behavior
SearchBar does not appear
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: iOS 10.3
- Last known good version: iOS 11.2
- IDE:

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[iOS] Searchbar in Horizontal Stacklayout doesn't render" (#3413) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Place a SearchBar control inside a Stacklayout with Orientation Horizontal and it won't render on iOS. It renders on Android and UWP just fine

https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/95897/search-bar-in-horizontal-stacklayout

### Steps to Reproduce

Create a page with the following XAML

```XAML
<StackLayout Orientation="Horizontal">
            <SearchBar  BackgroundColor="Yellow"  Text="candy mountain" ></SearchBar>
        </StackLayout> 
```

### Expected Behavior
SearchBar should render

### Actual Behavior
SearchBar doesn't render

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.2
- Last known good version: I tested as far back as 2.5.1 and it didn't render there either
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  11.4

### Screenshots
Android:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5375137/43291393-825bd31c-90ee-11e8-8c50-da4e4a07bbe1.png)

iOS:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5375137/43291402-8e8e3c60-90ee-11e8-8c7f-b2d7a225f031.png)


### Reproduction Link
 
[StackLayout.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2233747/StackLayout.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[UWP] Fixed double set margins in Layouts" (#3570) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

In PR https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/pull/2515 there was a mistake due to which all `Margin` properties inside `StackLayout` / `AbsoluteLayout` were applied twice.

### Issues Resolved ###

- fixes #3398 
- fixes #3616

### API Changes ###

<!-- List all API changes here (or just put None), example:

Added:
 - string ListView.GroupName { get; set; } //Bindable Property
 - int ListView.GroupId { get; set; } // Bindable Property
 - void ListView.Clear ();

Changed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem -->

### Platforms Affected ###

- UWP

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

Labels and other elements with `Margin` property are correctly displayed inside in layouts.

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Remove ver check" (#3686) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody: Remove version check. Split into 3 statements.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[iOS] Specify a default size for UISearchBar width if needed" (#3635) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

As of latest versions of iOS11.3 seems that passing the max value to the UISearchBar for sizing breaks.
This only happens when we don't specify any Width request for the SearchBar and the SearchBar is requested to stretch itself. 
We could try to pass a enormous value but I figure this was a best call. 

At the same time we found out iOS10 also wasn't rendering , the issue that is SizeThatFits always is retiring a 0 Width , we override the call and set the width. 

### Issues Resolved ###

- fixes #3413 
- fixes #2139  

### API Changes ###

None

### Platforms Affected ###

- iOS

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

Should show the Searchbar inside a horizontal StackLayout and blue SearchBar Expanding

Before:

It crashed  and didn't renderer the blue SearchBar with CenterAndExpand

After:

IOS 10
![simulator screen shot - iphone 5 - 2018-08-29 at 12 38 38](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1235097/44786344-b88f4100-ab8b-11e8-982b-f49f0ff96098.png)
![simulator screen shot - iphone 5 - 2018-08-29 at 12 38 46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1235097/44786347-b927d780-ab8b-11e8-8c52-5b5af68dcd63.png)

iOS11
![simulator screen shot - iphone x - 2018-08-29 at 12 20 30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1235097/44786348-b927d780-ab8b-11e8-9742-7749febf409a.png)
![simulator screen shot - iphone x - 2018-08-29 at 12 20 44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1235097/44786349-b927d780-ab8b-11e8-8d51-34d370952729.png)

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [ ] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Every app including the template app crashes on iOS9.3" (#4741) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new app
2. Run it on iOS 9.3 simulator
3. 

### Expected Behavior
The app runs (an XCode template app runs from the XCode so it is not a simulator/XCode issue)
### Actual Behavior
The app crashes on the launch screen
### Environment

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[XCode 10] Metal Game Template app fails to build with MSB6003 error" (#4436) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Metal Game Template app fails to build with MSB6003 error

**Build Info:**
 - Version 7.5.4 (build 5)
 - Mono 5.10.1.57 (2017-12/ea8a24b1bbf) (64-bit)
 - Xamarin.Android Version: 8.3.3.2
 - Xamarin.Mac Version: 4.99.1.164
 - Xamarin.iOS Version: 11.99.1.44
 - Apple Developer Tools Xcode 10.0 (14301.4) Build 10L201y
 - Operating System Mac OS X 10.14.0
 - Xamarin.Profiler Version: 1.6.2
 - Xamarin Inspector Version: 1.4.0

**Detailed Build Info:**
https://gist.github.com/GLjackyvaswani/bbf556eb8dbfe16e7619c6013a863a5c

**Steps:**
1. Create a new Metal Game Template project.
2. Build the project.

**Expected Result:**
Project should build successfully.

**Actual Result:**
Build fails with MSB6003 error.

**Reproducible:**
100% Happens Everytime

**Test Case Link:**
https://testrail.xamarin.com/index.php?/tests/view/24588979&group_by=tests:assignedto_id&group_order=desc&group_id=-1

**Test Plan Link:**
https://testrail.xamarin.com/index.php?/plans/view/55801

**Build Output Logs:**
https://gist.github.com/GLjackyvaswani/c0c9b79e1a16e4d6c833d5c955caac04

**Screen Cast Link:**
https://www.screencast.com/t/PQsN83yqIqX

Attached IDE logs for reference.
[Ide.2018-07-12__18-25-27.log](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/files/2188702/Ide.2018-07-12__18-25-27.log)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Debugger terminates unexpectedly with error "the instruction pointer of the currently executing method (METHOD_NAME) is not on the recorded stack"" (#4362) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

Happens intermittently **but very frequently** while stepping through the code in the debugger, of an iOS app running in the iOS simulator of the connected Mac. Not sure when exactly this started happening, but my guess would be it started with the 15.7 release.

### Expected Behavior

N/A - debugging should simply work.

### Actual Behavior

When stepping through code in the debugger (hitting F10 or F11) the app and the debugging session terminates unexpectedly. The Debug output window shows:

```
[0x70000346d000] The instruction pointer of the currently executing method (METHOD_NAME) is not on the recorded stack. This is likely due to a runtime bug. The 1 frames are as follow: 
2018-06-28 20:45:00.176 IDeliverable.Retrospect.Xamarin.iOS[33333:8198052] error: * Assertion at /Users/builder/data/lanes/5944/64fece5f/source/xamarin-macios/external/mono/mono/mini/debugger-agent.c:4702, condition `method_in_stack' not met
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[MT5216] Xamarin.iOS library binding issue" (#4520) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Xamarin.iOS binding project, to try to bind the iOS Framework of https://bear2b.com/
2. Create necessary ApiDefinitions and StructsAndEnums, and build the iOS binding library project
3. Reference the binding project into a xamarin.ios project, and build it

### Expected Behavior
Build process should be fine for the xamarin.ios project

### Actual Behavior
A "Native Linking" error is raised
Error MT5216: Native linking failed for '/Users/Adrien/Projects/BearSdk/BearSdk.Demo.iOS/obj/iPhone/Debug/mtouch-cache/arm64/libBearkSdk.iOS.dll.dylib'. Please file a bug report at http://bugzilla.xamarin.com (MT5216) (BearSdk.Demo.iOS)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "UIPrintPageRenderer returns 'NumberOfPages' as Zero with the big size HTML file having CSS reference and lots of SVGs in it. Due to this, an 'Empty' PDF page is getting created." (#4408) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Prepare a HTML file with more than 10 pages containing CSS and lot of SVGs (so that it takes long time to render)
2. Develop a code to load this HTML file from bundle to WKWebView
3. Create the UIPrintPageRenderer from WKWebView for printing.
4. Verify that 'NumberOfPages' of the UIPrintPageRenderer returns 0 (Zero). For this, empty page PDF file is getting created.

### Expected Behavior
DidFinishNavigation should not return until complete HTML page is fully rendered on the View and the UIPrintPageRenderer should correctly return the number of pages based on the 'page rect' size specified.

### Actual Behavior
The 'NumberOfPages' of the UIPrintPageRenderer returns 0 (Zero). For this, empty page PDF file is getting created.
### Environment
iOS Xamarin (Tested using both Visual studio in Windows and iOS)

<!--
1.
Visual Studio: Help > About Microsoft Visual Studio > Copy Info [button]
Visual Studio for Mac: Visual Studio > About Visual Studio > Show Details > Copy Information [button]
2. Paste into the code block below (between ```)
-->

```
Microsoft Visual Studio Professional 2015
Version 14.0.25431.01 Update 3
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.6.01590

Xamarin   4.5.0.443 (c871575)
Visual Studio extension to enable development for Xamarin.iOS and Xamarin.Android.

Xamarin.Android   7.3.0.13 (448f54f)
Visual Studio extension to enable development for Xamarin.Android.

Xamarin.iOS   10.10.0.30 (30b6e87)
Visual Studio extension to enable development for Xamarin.iOS.
```

### Build Logs

<!--
1. Place cursor below this comment block.
2. Attach build log or link to gist (https://gist.github.com/) of the log.
-->

<!--
1. Place cursor below this comment block.
2. Drag and drop the compressed project or files needed to reproduce.
-->

<!--
Switch to the "Preview" tab to ensure your issue renders correctly.
-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ArgumentNullException on TextContentType property of UITextField" (#4409) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- 🚨 STOP 🚨 𝗦𝗧𝗢𝗣 🚨 𝑺𝑻𝑶𝑷 🚨 -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->

### Steps to Reproduce

In the login form of our app we added this property to the password UITextField: 
PasswordField.TextContentType = UITextContentType.Password;

Now when some users update their app to a version that contains this property, they receive the ArgumentNullException described below.

I can't easily reproduce the error: it happens only on some iPad of our users (even with the latests iOS) and only after an update of the app. 
If the user uninstalls the app and installs it again, the exception isn't raised anymore.

### Expected Behavior

No error is raised.

### Actual Behavior

An exception of this type is raised when the TextContentType property is set:

System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. Parameter name: value
at UIKit.UITextField.set_TextContentType (Foundation.NSString value)

### Environment

App built with AppCenter using Mono version 5.10.1 and Xcode version 9.4.1.

### Build Logs

<!--
1. Place cursor below this comment block.
2. Attach build log or link to gist (https://gist.github.com/) of the log.
-->

### Example Project (If Possible)

<!--
1. Place cursor below this comment block.
2. Drag and drop the compressed project or files needed to reproduce.
-->

Switch to the "Preview" tab to ensure your issue renders correctly.
-->
